results.title: U-turn
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Pictures, Illusion Entertainment Group, Clyde is Hungry Films, Clayton Townsend, Dan Halsted and Oliver Stone
results.brief_description: Bobby Cooper (Sean Penn) is a former tennis pro, now a small time gambler on the run from some bookies who will do anything to get their money back. On his way to Las Vegas to pay his debt, he car breaks down in a small desert town. Whilst waiting for his car to be fixed by quirky mechanic Darrell (Billy Bob Thornton), Bobby meets and becomes attracted to Grace (Jennifer Lopez) who unbeknownst to him, is married to Jake (Nick Nolte), a much older and seemingly possessive man who is furious when he discovers them together. When Bobby is unable to pay for the repairs to his car and Jake offers to pay Bobby to kill his wife, he agrees, becoming involved in a situation far worse than anything he has ever imagined - when Grace makes him an offer he can’t refuse. The town characters creating havoc in Bobby’s world include a wisdom-spouting blind veteran (Jon Voight), Jenny, (Claire Danes) a troubled teenager trying to escape the confines of the town and her abusive boyfriend Toby N. Tucker (Joaquin Phoenix) and the Sheriff (Powers Boothe) trying to maintain order in the town, despite hiding a secret of his own. Also includes appearances by Laurie Metcalf and Liv Tyler. Based on the novel ‘Stray Dogs’ by John Ridley.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phoenix Pictures, Illusion Entertainment Group, Clyde is Hungry Films, Clayton Townsend, Dan Halsted and Oliver Stone

results.title: Tyrannosaurus Rex
results.creator_credit: WGBH Educational Foundation and D. Keith Carlson
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child”
Children are shown working together on a project to reconstruct the land of dinosaurs, using papier-mache to create hills, trees, a moat, and some shallow water. They paint and classify toy models of dinosaurs.

results.title: Typing technique
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Michael Law
results.brief_description: A number of common errors by typists illustrated and corrected in a humorous manner. The items covered include the taking of dictation, proper sitting posture when typing, general typing technique and care of the machine.

results.title: Typing skills: position and keystroke
results.creator_credit: Coronet Films, Creative Establishment and Don B. Klugman
results.brief_description: Janet Wilner’s company selected her for a time-mtion study and discovered that good typing starts with a typist’s position at the typewriter and with the way she manages her keystroke. Extensive slow-motion photography reveals the basic elements of good typing.

results.title: Typing skills: daily job techniques. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Illustrates that on-the-job proficiency requires adequate preparation for the day’s work, in addition to mastery of basic operating skills. Shows how a typist can eliminate needless movement and increase her output.

results.title: Types of criminal sanctions
results.creator_credit: Video Classroom, Geoff Russell and Peter Wiseman
results.brief_description: How do we punish criminals? Reveals the many dilemmas faced by our legal system in balancing society’s expectation for protection (and the punishment and rehabilitation of offenders) against the rights of the criminal in order to ultimately reach a ‘just’ outcome. What is a ‘just outcome’ for both the individual and the community? These and other key questions are explored through interviews with prisoners, County Court Judges and other legal interest groups. Explains and discusses the main types of criminal sanctions issued by most Australian courts: Admonishment, Fines, Community based Corrections, Imprisonment, other innovations, such as Home Detention and private prisons.

results.title: Ty's homemade band
results.creator_credit: Evergreen Productions, Phoenix Film and Gary Templeton
results.brief_description: A stranger appears in town and helps a group of young children form their own homemade band, with the instruments made out of domestic utensils, and the children put on a concert for the neighbourhood. Ty’s one man band by Mildred Pitts Walter.

results.title: Two/out [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Kriv Stenders, Pod Films and Catherine Kerr
results.brief_description:
Jack and Tom are cellmates with a tenuous friendship. Their fragile bond begins to unravel when Jack develops dementia, and Tom, unable to understand Jack’s condition forces them into a physical confrontation which challenges the nature of their relationship.
Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.
